result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Phillip John

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Phillip John in court.  Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court for Juan Phillip John.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and requests additional time to review the material with his client. Court reiterated the conditions of bail with the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Phillip John appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler appeared by video for Juan Phillip John.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of Defendant's prior OWI convictions. Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Officer K. Webster. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Crivello, Branch 36.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Juan Phillip John in court with Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer and Appearance.  Received and Filed.  nk

Adjustment Number: 22A 079633,
Payable Number: 1026886,
Receipt Number: 22RP033359,
Amount: $20.00
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Juan Phillip John not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/08/2022@230pm
